element.label: Axis scaling mode
element.desc: Selects between automatic, full scale and manual axis scaling.

element.label: Axis mapping mode
element.desc: Select between linear, logarithmic and decibel axis mapping.

element.label: Axis zoom in
element.desc: Zooms the respective axis in by a factor of 2.

element.label: Axis zoom out
element.desc: Zooms the respective axis out by a factor of 2.

element.label: Rescale axis to data
element.desc: Rescale the foreground Y axis in the selected zoom area.

element.label: Save figure
element.desc: Generates an SVG of the plot area or areas for dual plots to the local download folder.

element.label: Save data
element.desc: Generates a TXT consisting of the displayed set of samples. Select full scale to save the complete wave. The save data function only saves one shot at a time (the last displayed wave).

element.label: Cursor control
element.desc: Cursors can be switch On/Off and set to be moved both independently or one bound to the other one.

element.label: Display
element.desc: Predefined filters that limit the view to specific signal groups. The display filter does not select any nodes.

element.label: All
element.desc: Select all nodes that can be selected in the relevant context.

element.label: None
element.desc: Unselect all nodes.

element.label: Vertical Axis Group
element.desc: Manages signal groups sharing a common vertical axis. Show or hide signals by changing the check box state. Split a group by dropping signals to the field [Drop signal here to add new group]. Remove signals by dragging them on a free area.
element.descExt: Rename group names by editing the group label. Axis tick labels of the selected group are shown in the plot. Cursor elements of the active wave (selected) are added in the cursor math tab.

element.label: Signal Type
element.desc: Select signal types for the Vertical Axis Group.

element.label: Channel
element.desc: Selects a channel to be added.

element.label: Add Signal
element.desc: Adds a signal to the plot. The signal will be added to its default group. It may be moved by drag and drop to its own group. All signals within a group share a common y-axis. Select a group to bring its axis to the foreground and display its labels.

element.label: Source Select
element.desc: Select from a list of input sources for math operations.

option.label: Cursor Loc
option.desc: Cursor coordinates as input data.

option.label: Cursor Area
option.desc: Consider all plot data inside the rectangle defined by the cursor coordinates as input for statistical functions (Min, Max, Avg, Std, Int).

option.label: Tracking
option.desc: Output plot value at current cursor position. Options are X1 and X2.

option.label: Plot Area
option.desc: Consider all plot data currently displayed in the Plot as input for statistical functions (Min, Max, Avg, Std, Int).

option.label: Peak
option.desc: Find and determine the various peaks in the plotted data and their associated values.

option.label: Histogram
option.desc: Select statistical data as Math input and display a histogram in the plot area.

element.label: Operation Select
element.desc: Select from a list of mathematical operations to be performed on the selected signals. Choice offered depends on input signals selected.

option.label: X1, X2, X2-X1, Y1, Y2, Y2-Y1
option.desc: Cursors values and their differences.

option.label: Min, Max, Avg, Std, Int
option.desc: Statistical Functions applied to a set of samples.

option.label: Pos, Level
option.desc: Finds the Position (x-values) and the Levels (y-values) of Peaks on a set of samples.

element.label: Add
element.desc: Add the selected math function to the result table below.

element.label: Add All
element.desc: Add all operations for the selected signal to the result table below.

element.label: Select All
element.desc: Select all lines from the result table above.

element.label: Clear Selected
element.desc: Clear selected lines from the result table above.

element.label: Unit Prefix
element.desc: Adds a suitable prefix to the SI units to allow for better readability and increase of significant digits displayed.

element.label: CSV
element.desc: Values of the current result table are saved as a text file into the download folder.

element.label: Link
element.desc: Provides a LabOne Net Link to use the data in tools like Excel, Matlab, etc.

element.label: Help
element.desc: Opens the LabOne User Interface help.
